parts.text:
[Statement 1]: Several methods for controlling sea lice on Atlantic salmon farms have been evaluated.
[Statement 2]: Corkwing and goldskinny cleaner wrasse were as effective at controlling lice infestation as chemical treatments.
[Statement 3]: Rockcook cleaner wrasse were ineffective at preventing lice outbreaks.
[Statement 4]: Salmon kept in low intensity artificial light or natural lighting had lower numbers of lice compared to salmon under more intense artificial light.
[Statement 5]: Lower lice numbers were recorded on Atlantic salmon in cages using a fallowing system.
[Statement 6]: Studies did not directly compare the cost-effectiveness of different sea lice control methods.
[Statement 7]: No specific economic analysis or cost data was provided to determine which method for controlling sea lice is most cost-effective.

key: _claude-sonnet-4__What is the most cost-effective method for controlling sea lice on Atlantic salmon farms?
